educational.hook: 🧱 THREAD: 5 things every homeowner should know about brick maintenance (that most contractors won't tell you)
educational.body:
🧱 THREAD: 5 things every homeowner should know about brick maintenance (that most contractors won't tell you)

1/ Brick doesn't fail. Mortar does.

Your brick will outlast you. It's the mortar joints that need attention every 25-30 years. Ignore them and water gets in—then you've got real problems.

2/ Not all tuckpointing is equal.

Mortar must be SOFTER than the brick. Too many contractors use hard Portland cement mix that damages brick. Proper lime-based mortar is crucial for pre-1930s buildings.

3/ Power washing brick = bad idea.

High pressure damages mortar joints and the brick face. We use low-pressure chemical cleaning. Your brick's protective fire skin matters.

4/ "Waterproof" sealers trap moisture.

Brick needs to breathe. Use breathable water repellents, not sealers. Trapped moisture causes spalling (brick face popping off). We see this constantly.

5/ White staining (efflorescence) is a WARNING.

Those white deposits mean water is moving through your masonry. Don't just clean it—find and fix the source. Usually failed mortar, missing flashing, or drainage issues.

BONUS: Cracks wider than [MEASUREMENT] need professional assessment. They might indicate foundation issues, not just cosmetic problems.
